channel.title: How to fix 'java is not recognized as an internal or external command'
channel.description:
These topics are getting very popular, and every reply is saying 'replace your compiler with this: etc etc etc'. [b]THE PROBLEM IS NOT WITH YOUR COMPILER. [/b] to fix this, right click on your runserver.bat and click edit, you should see something that says:
[code] java server [/code]
change it to [code] java -cp . server [/code]
If your runserver.bat is one of those cruddy ones that another person made and dont like it then change it to:
[code] @echo off java -cp . server pause [/code]

item.title: How to fix 'java is not recognized as an internal or external command'
item.dc:creator: @Pwnage_Sh0w Pwnage Sh0w
item.description:
@Pwnage_Sh0w wrote:

you gotta download JDK 6 Update 7 (online version) and install it. that will fix the problem thats what happened to me

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix 'java is not recognized as an internal or external command'
item.dc:creator: @idontknoww idontknoww
item.description:
@idontknoww wrote:

Ok… I am trying to use Reapage-scape, it had this in it’s run

@echo off color 0a title ReapageScape java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

I have JDK 1.6_10 or w/e, but it closes out after like a millisecond any help?

Btw, this is its actual name on the Java download site Java SE 6 Update 10 RC

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix 'java is not recognized as an internal or external command'
item.dc:creator: @ben123249 ben123249
item.description:
@ben123249 wrote:

hi i have my server up and runing and all can conect but my client doesnt work… i get this error:

rw.jpg1024×768

Anyone can tell me what to do to get this to work ? (I DO HAVE THE LATEST JAVA!)

and incase you need it

Inside run.bat it says:
@ECHO OFF
TITLE Berky-Scape
color 0a
JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI
PAUSE

Inside compile.bat it says:
@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Read full topic
